segment.source: Configure Windows Defender ATP endpoint proxy and Internet connection settings
segment.target: Configure Windows Defender ATP endpoint proxy and Internet connection settings

segment.source: Configure the Windows Defender ATP proxy and internet settings to enable communication with the cloud service.
segment.target: Configure the Windows Defender ATP proxy and internet settings to enable communication with the cloud service.

segment.source: Configure endpoint proxy and Internet connectivity settings
segment.target: Configure endpoint proxy and Internet connectivity settings

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later
segment.target: Windows 10 Insider Preview Build 14332 or later

segment.source: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)
segment.target: Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection (Windows Defender ATP)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.]

segment.source: The Window Defender ATP sensor requires Microsoft Windows HTTP (WinHTTP) to report telemetry and communicate with the Windows Defender ATP service.
segment.target: The Window Defender ATP sensor requires Microsoft Windows HTTP (WinHTTP) to report telemetry and communicate with the Windows Defender ATP service.

segment.source: The embedded Windows Defender ATP sensor runs in system context using the LocalSystem account.
segment.target: The embedded Windows Defender ATP sensor runs in system context using the LocalSystem account.

segment.source: The sensor uses Microsoft Windows HTTP Services (WinHTTP) to enable communication with the Windows Defender ATP cloud service.
segment.target: The sensor uses Microsoft Windows HTTP Services (WinHTTP) to enable communication with the Windows Defender ATP cloud service.

segment.source: The WinHTTP configuration setting is independent of the Windows Internet (WinINet) internet browsing proxy settings and can only discover a proxy server by using the following discovery methods:
segment.target: The WinHTTP configuration setting is independent of the Windows Internet (WinINet) internet browsing proxy settings and can only discover a proxy server by using the following discovery methods:

segment.source: Configure Web Proxy Auto Detect (WPAD) settings and configure Windows to automatically detect the proxy server
segment.target: Configure Web Proxy Auto Detect (WPAD) settings and configure Windows to automatically detect the proxy server

segment.source: Configure the proxy server manually using Netsh
segment.target: Configure the proxy server manually using Netsh

segment.source: Configure Web Proxy Auto Detect (WPAD) settings and proxy server
segment.target: Configure Web Proxy Auto Detect (WPAD) settings and proxy server

segment.source: Configure WPAD in the environment and configure Windows to automatically detect the proxy server through Policy or the local Windows settings.
segment.target: Configure WPAD in the environment and configure Windows to automatically detect the proxy server through Policy or the local Windows settings.

segment.source: Enable the Automatically detect settings option in the Windows Proxy settings so that WinHTTP can use the WPAD feature to locate a proxy server.
segment.target: Enable the Automatically detect settings option in the Windows Proxy settings so that WinHTTP can use the WPAD feature to locate a proxy server.

segment.source: Click Start and select Settings.
segment.target: Click Start and select Settings.

segment.source: Click Network & Internet.
segment.target: Click Network & Internet.

segment.source: Select Proxy.
segment.target: Select Proxy.

segment.source: Verify that the Automatically detect settings option is set to On.
segment.target: Verify that the Automatically detect settings option is set to On.

segment.source: Image showing the proxy settings configuration page
segment.target: Image showing the proxy settings configuration page

segment.source: If the Use setup script or Manual proxy setup options are enabled then you will need to configure proxy settings manually by using Netsh method for WinHTTP to discover the appropriate proxy settings and connect.
segment.target: If the Use setup script or Manual proxy setup options are enabled then you will need to configure proxy settings manually by using Netsh method for WinHTTP to discover the appropriate proxy settings and connect.

segment.source: Configure the proxy server manually using Netsh
segment.target: Configure the proxy server manually using Netsh

segment.source: If Use setup script or Manual proxy setup settings are configured in the Windows Proxy setting, then endpoints will not be discovered by WinHTTP.
segment.target: If Use setup script or Manual proxy setup settings are configured in the Windows Proxy setting, then endpoints will not be discovered by WinHTTP.

segment.source: Use Netsh to configure the proxy settings to enable connectivity.
segment.target: Use Netsh to configure the proxy settings to enable connectivity.

segment.source: You can configure the endpoint by using any of these methods:
segment.target: You can configure the endpoint by using any of these methods:

segment.source: Importing the configured proxy settings to WinHTTP
segment.target: Importing the configured proxy settings to WinHTTP

segment.source: Configuring the proxy settings manually to WinHTTP
segment.target: Configuring the proxy settings manually to WinHTTP

segment.source: After configuring the endpoints, you'll need to verify that the correct proxy settings were applied.
segment.target: After configuring the endpoints, you'll need to verify that the correct proxy settings were applied.

segment.source: Import the configured proxy settings to WinHTTP
segment.target: Import the configured proxy settings to WinHTTP

segment.source: Open an elevated command-line prompt on the endpoint:
segment.target: Open an elevated command-line prompt on the endpoint:

segment.source: a.
segment.target: a.

segment.source: Click Start and type cmd.
segment.target: Click Start and type cmd.

segment.source: b.
segment.target: b.

segment.source: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Enter the following command and press Enter:
segment.target: Enter the following command and press Enter:

segment.source: An output showing the applied WinHTTP proxy settings is displayed.
segment.target: An output showing the applied WinHTTP proxy settings is displayed.

segment.source: Configure the proxy settings manually to WinHTTP
segment.target: Configure the proxy settings manually to WinHTTP

segment.source: Open an elevated command-line prompt on the endpoint:
segment.target: Open an elevated command-line prompt on the endpoint:

segment.source: a.
segment.target: a.

segment.source: Click Start and type cmd.
segment.target: Click Start and type cmd.

segment.source: b.
segment.target: b.

segment.source: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Enter the following command and press Enter:
segment.target: Enter the following command and press Enter:

segment.source: Replace ProxyServerName with the fully qualified domain name of the proxy server.
segment.target: Replace ProxyServerName with the fully qualified domain name of the proxy server.

segment.source: Replace PortNumber with the port number that you want to configure the proxy server with.
segment.target: Replace PortNumber with the port number that you want to configure the proxy server with.

segment.source: An output showing the applied WinHTTP proxy settings is displayed.
segment.target: An output showing the applied WinHTTP proxy settings is displayed.

segment.source: Verify that the correct proxy settings were applied
segment.target: Verify that the correct proxy settings were applied

segment.source: Open an elevated command-line prompt on the endpoint:
segment.target: Open an elevated command-line prompt on the endpoint:

segment.source: a.
segment.target: a.

segment.source: Click Start and type cmd.
segment.target: Click Start and type cmd.

segment.source: b.
segment.target: b.

segment.source: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Enter the following command and press Enter:
segment.target: Enter the following command and press Enter:

segment.source: For more information on how to use Netsh see, Netsh Commands for Windows Hypertext Transfer Protocol (WINHTTP)
segment.target: For more information on how to use Netsh see, Netsh Commands for Windows Hypertext Transfer Protocol (WINHTTP)

segment.source: Enable access to Windows Defender ATP service URLs in the proxy server
segment.target: Enable access to Windows Defender ATP service URLs in the proxy server

segment.source: If a proxy or firewall is blocking all traffic by default and allowing only specific domains through, make sure that the following URLs are white-listed to permit communication with Windows Defender ATP service in port 80 and 443:
segment.target: If a proxy or firewall is blocking all traffic by default and allowing only specific domains through, make sure that the following URLs are white-listed to permit communication with Windows Defender ATP service in port 80 and 443:

segment.source: us.vortex-win.data.microsoft.com
segment.target: us.vortex-win.data.microsoft.com

segment.source: eu.vortex-win.data.microsoft.com
segment.target: eu.vortex-win.data.microsoft.com

segment.source: sevillegwcus.microsoft.com
segment.target: sevillegwcus.microsoft.com

segment.source: sevillegweus.microsoft.com
segment.target: sevillegweus.microsoft.com

segment.source: sevillegwweu.microsoft.com
segment.target: sevillegwweu.microsoft.com

segment.source: sevillegwneu.microsoft.com
segment.target: sevillegwneu.microsoft.com

segment.source: www.microsoft.com
segment.target: www.microsoft.com

segment.source: crl.microsoft.com
segment.target: crl.microsoft.com

segment.source: .blob.core.windows.net
segment.target: .blob.core.windows.net

segment.source: If a proxy or firewall is blocking anonymous traffic, as Windows Defender ATP sensor is connecting from system context, make sure anonymous traffic is permitted to the above listed URLs.
segment.target: If a proxy or firewall is blocking anonymous traffic, as Windows Defender ATP sensor is connecting from system context, make sure anonymous traffic is permitted to the above listed URLs.

segment.source: Verify client connectivity to Windows Defender ATP service URLs
segment.target: Verify client connectivity to Windows Defender ATP service URLs

segment.source: Verify the proxy configuration completed successfully, that WinHTTP can discover and communicate through the proxy server in your environment, and that the proxy server allows traffic to the Windows Defender ATP service URLs.
segment.target: Verify the proxy configuration completed successfully, that WinHTTP can discover and communicate through the proxy server in your environment, and that the proxy server allows traffic to the Windows Defender ATP service URLs.

segment.source: Download the connectivity verification tools to the PC where Windows Defender ATP sensor is running on:
segment.target: Download the connectivity verification tools to the PC where Windows Defender ATP sensor is running on:

segment.source: Download PsTools Suite
segment.target: Download PsTools Suite

segment.source: Download PortQry Command Line Port Scanner Version 2.0 utility
segment.target: Download PortQry Command Line Port Scanner Version 2.0 utility

segment.source: Extract the contents of PsTools and PortQry to a directory on the computer hard drive.
segment.target: Extract the contents of PsTools and PortQry to a directory on the computer hard drive.

segment.source: Open an elevated command-line:
segment.target: Open an elevated command-line:

segment.source: a.
segment.target: a.

segment.source: Click Start and type cmd.
segment.target: Click Start and type cmd.

segment.source: b.
segment.target: b.

segment.source: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Command prompt and select Run as administrator.

segment.source: Enter the following command and press Enter:
segment.target: Enter the following command and press Enter:

segment.source: Replace HardDrivePath with the path where the PsTools Suite was extracted to: Image showing the command line
segment.target: Replace HardDrivePath with the path where the PsTools Suite was extracted to: Image showing the command line

segment.source: Enter the following command and press Enter:
segment.target: Enter the following command and press Enter:

segment.source: Replace HardDrivePath with the path where the PortQry utility was extracted to: Image showing the command line
segment.target: Replace HardDrivePath with the path where the PortQry utility was extracted to: Image showing the command line

segment.source: Verify that the output shows that the name is resolved and connection status is listening.
segment.target: Verify that the output shows that the name is resolved and connection status is listening.

segment.source: Repeat the same steps for the remaining URLs with the following arguments:
segment.target: Repeat the same steps for the remaining URLs with the following arguments:

segment.source: portqry.exe -n eu.vortex-win.data.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp
segment.target: portqry.exe -n eu.vortex-win.data.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp

segment.source: portqry.exe -n sevillegwcus.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp
segment.target: portqry.exe -n sevillegwcus.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp

segment.source: portqry.exe -n sevillegweus.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp
segment.target: portqry.exe -n sevillegweus.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp

segment.source: portqry.exe -n sevillegwweu.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp
segment.target: portqry.exe -n sevillegwweu.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp

segment.source: portqry.exe -n sevillegwneu.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp
segment.target: portqry.exe -n sevillegwneu.microsoft.com -e 443 -p tcp

segment.source: portqry.exe -n www.microsoft.com -e 80 -p tcp
segment.target: portqry.exe -n www.microsoft.com -e 80 -p tcp

segment.source: portqry.exe -n crl.microsoft.com -e 80 -p tcp
segment.target: portqry.exe -n crl.microsoft.com -e 80 -p tcp

segment.source: Verify that each URL shows that the name is resolved and the connection status is listening.
segment.target: Verify that each URL shows that the name is resolved and the connection status is listening.

segment.source: If the any of the verification steps indicate a fail, then verify that you have performed the proxy configuration steps to enable server discovery and access to the service URLs.
segment.target: If the any of the verification steps indicate a fail, then verify that you have performed the proxy configuration steps to enable server discovery and access to the service URLs.
